lead_paragraph: In a situation echoing the crisis in Flint, Mich., a housing complex’s poor, mostly black residents are being resettled because of high lead and arsenic levels.

headline.print_headline: 1,100 in Indiana, Their Soil Toxic, Are Uprooted
headline.main: Their Soil Toxic, 1,100 Indiana Residents Scramble to Find New Homes

snippet: In a situation echoing the crisis in Flint, Mich., a housing complex’s poor, mostly black residents are being resettled because of high lead and arsenic levels....
abstract: East Chicago, Ind, Mayor Anthony Copeland orders 1,100 largely poor and black residents to vacate homes in West Calument Housing Complex due to high levels of lead in soil; sudden decision to raze buildings defies EPA plan that would not have displaced anyone; residents of complex, which was built on site of former lead smelting plant and made Superfund site in 2009, express anger that they were not told of danger sooner.
